criterion: Reward for explicit documentation of the patient’s request to move metformin dosing from breakfast to lunch AND the clinician’s agreement or instructions about that change
Reward for documenting the discussion of medication adherence and self-monitoring of blood glucose (frequency, instances of forgetting, or consistency)
Reward for inclusion of patient-safety counseling related to metformin timing (need for consistency, taking with food to minimize GI side-effects, what to do if a dose is missed)
Reward for demonstrating evidence-based decision making by noting that metformin may be taken with any main meal without dose change and no anticipated impact on glycemic control
Penalize for missing, incorrect, or conflicting core medication details for metformin (name, dose, route, frequency) in the documentation
Penalize for absence of a documented follow-up or monitoring plan pertinent to diabetes control (e.g., SMBG schedule reinforcement or HbA1c/lab follow-up timeline)
Penalize for improper or inconsistent use of Canvas instruction categories (e.g., using AdjustPrescription when only counseling is given, or omitting an Instruct entry when counseling is documented)
Penalize for redundant, overly wordy, or irrelevant information not supported by the transcript or chart
